name: miseducate
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
to educate people in a way that is not correct: He said the party was systematically miseducating the masses about the revolution. The commission found that many school leavers were "under-educated or mis-educated", with very weak skills and knowledge in core subjects. Related word
miseducation
More examplesFewer examplesChildren were miseducated, often being labelled as problem pupils.This is something that our brainwashed and miseducated economists and governments are unable to comprehend.Film can be used to educate, but unfortunately also to miseducate. These economists, she claims, have been mis-educated into ignoring the dynamics of money and debt.
